New Records: Brandon King won the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock.
Key Match Events: West Indies defeated Sri Lanka by five wickets to take 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
Brandon King and Evin Lewis hit half-centuries for West Indies.
Kamindu Mendis and Charith Asalanka stitched a 82-run stand for Sri Lanka.
Sherfane Rutherford finished things off in style with a four off Matheesha Pathirana.
Rovman Powell, Chase, and Rutherford played smartly to take their side over the line.
West Indies needed just a couple of good knocks and that came from Powell, Chase, and Rutherford.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies captain Rovman Powell won the toss and opted to bowl first against Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka said he would have bowled first as well.
Powell said during the toss, “The field is on the wet side, hopefully our bowlers can make the most of the conditions.”
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon King wins the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock.
West Indies took a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium in Dambulla, Sri Lanka.
The weather conditions were wet, which affected the game.
Others: The West Indies squad included Evin Lewis, Brandon King, Shai Hope, Roston Chase, Romario Shepherd, Rovman Powell, Sherfane Rutherford, Shamar Springer, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie, Shamar Joseph, Andre Fletcher, Alick Athanaze, Fabian Allen, Terrance Hinds.

The Sri Lanka squad included Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis, Kusal Perera, Dinesh Chandimal, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Wanindu Hasaranga, Charith Asalanka, Avishka Fernando, Dunith Wellalage, Kamindu Mendis, Chamindu Wickramasinghe, Maheesh Theekshana, Asitha Fernando, Matheesha Pathirana, Binura Fernando, Jeffrey Vandersay, Nuwan Thushara.
